meanings.definition: The act of producing something jointly with another party.
meanings.sent1: The coproduction of the school play involved students and teachers working together.
meanings.sent2: The coproduction of the new movie brought together actors and producers.
meanings.sent3: The coproduction of the birthday cake by the siblings led to a messy kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Their coproduction of the science project was like a symphony of ideas coming together.
meanings.sent5: The coproduction of the charity event made a lasting impact on the community.

meanings.definition: A product or project that is created through collaboration between multiple parties.
meanings.sent1: The coproduction of the music album involved singers and songwriters.
meanings.sent2: The coproduction of the research paper required input from various experts.
meanings.sent3: The coproduction of the family dinner resulted in a delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: Their coproduction of the art exhibition was a masterpiece of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The coproduction of the community garden brought neighbors closer together.
